noun.description: A person who or organization which provides remuneration or reward.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Chillingworth (1602–1644), theologian. Either from post-classical Latin remunerator rewarder, recompenser (Vulgate; late 2nd cent. in Tertullian; from classical Latin remūnerāt-, past participial stem of remūnerārī + -or), or from remunerate + -or.
